name: Jobs Common
tagline: Easily integrate job board APIs into your PHP application
body:
### About the project
A few months ago I was playing around with several job board APIs when I realized that there was a huge lack of standardization in the way in which their APIs were written and accessed. Some of the problems I spotted right out of the gate were:

- Every job board’s API demands different request parameters
- Every API returns a different object type; some will only do XML, some JSON, and the names of fields can be just about anything
- Some require API/Publisher keys
- Some have libraries, some don’t; very few have good ones in PHP
- Even if there are libraries, they still return non-standard results so you can’t compare one with another
- Many of the PHP libraries are outdated, and don’t take advantage of stuff like Composer which makes it super easy to include in a project

So, I created an early version of this project and [blogged about it](http://www.karllhughes.com/2015/php-job-search-api-clients/) back in March, 2015. Steven Maguire saw the post and asked if I was interested in collaborating on a more mature version. Thanks to his well-crafted rewrite, we have what is here today.

Even though the code has improved significantly, the goal has remained the same: to provide PHP developers with a simple and standardized way to access job board APIs.

### Providers
List of providers currently available:
- [SimplyHired](https://github.com/JobBrander/jobs-simplyhired)
- [Indeed](https://github.com/JobBrander/jobs-indeed)
- [Careerbuilder](https://github.com/JobBrander/jobs-careerbuilder)
- [Dice](https://github.com/JobBrander/jobs-dice)
- [Government Jobs](https://github.com/JobBrander/jobs-govt)
- [Careercast](https://github.com/JobBrander/jobs-careercast)

We have a long list of more providers we'd like to have someday. If you're interested in contributing, see below.

### Contributors
We welcome contributions, pull requests, issue submissions, and general feedback from anyone in the PHP community! Feel free to reach out to us or send an email to info@jobbrander.com.
- @karllhughes
- @stevenmaguire
